name: Kadai Paneer
history: Kadai Paneer is a popular dish in Indian cuisine, particularly in the Northern regions. It gets its name from the 'Kadai' or wok in which it is cooked. This dish is known for its rich and spicy tomato-based sauce and soft paneer cubes.
description: Kadai Paneer is a flavorful curry made with paneer (Indian cottage cheese), bell peppers, onions, and an array of spices. The dish is cooked in a thick tomato gravy with a special blend of spices known as Kadai masala, giving it a unique and robust flavor.

ingredients.item: kadai masala (blend of coriander seeds, cumin seeds, fennel seeds, and dry red chilies)

instructions.title: Prepare Kadai Masala
instructions.description: Dry roast the coriander seeds, cumin seeds, fennel seeds, and dry red chilies. Grind them into a fine powder to make the Kadai masala.

instructions.title: Cook Onions and Bell Peppers
instructions.description: Heat oil in a kadai or wok. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. SautÃ© onions and bell peppers until slightly soft.

instructions.title: Add Spices and Tomatoes
instructions.description: Add ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and half of the Kadai masala. Cook for a few minutes. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.

instructions.title: Add Paneer and Simmer
instructions.description: Add the paneer cubes and remaining Kadai masala. Add water to adjust the consistency and simmer for 5-7 minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with naan or rice.

tips: Ensure the paneer is fresh for the best taste and texture.
Adjust the consistency of the gravy according to your preference.
variations: Add cream for a richer gravy.
Include other vegetables like peas or mushrooms for added nutrition.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until warm.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving bowl.
Garnish with a lemon wedge or sliced onions for added flavor.
